fnbI6vw2e6NvCcg_hTBxFg.text: Super-tasty food, decent portions, crowded but cozy ambience and friendly service.  This place was great.  Oh, and affordable!

gsJTNvi22je27n5RuypL5A.text: A really great turkish/morrocan restaurant in the heart of Islington. Friendly staff, cool furnishings and, most importantly obviously, really great food. There are loads of restaurants to choose from on Upper Street, but this should definitely be high on your priority list.

SpfqhAsPfxZSI8krMy98Nw.text: The food here is really good value, very tasy and service is friendly. It's quite a cramped place but that adds to the atmosphere, especially when it's someone's birthday and they're encouraged to get up on the table and dance! The food is hot and cold meze and grillied meats, although on the weekend they do english breakfast and at lunch they do sandwiches in pitta bread with falafel, kofta etc. The squid is really good, as is the scampi, chicken wings, humous and grilled meat. You can really fill up on a good meal for £15 if you don't have much alcohol. The staff are very friendly and it's a great place to meet up with friends.

3ocB2Hpz75YhIwnRFtwHLQ.text: One of the three gallipoli reastraunts found on upper street. Some of the finest turkish cusine available in London. The meze is wonderfull as is the lamb and the decor. Many turkish lanterns hang from the ceiling giving a fantastic ambiance while you eat. Service is a tad slow but this is without question a good place to eat. Most main courses will set you back less than £10 and the food is well worth it.

QN6lZUThlieb7I6Uu59Ipw.text: I have been to the Gallipoli at 120 Upper Street and had a great time however I do slightly prefer the one at 102 Upper Street.I'm not sure but I think this is the original Gallipoli and I just love the atmosphere in here and I love all the turkish lamps that adorn the ceiling. If you are over 5 and half foot tall you will probably have to bend down to get round some of the lamps, but they do all look stunning.The set menu for a group is great value and I will be dragging my work colleagues there for our Christmas meal this year.

VEks20tDu6Jt8FQngtEfjA.text: I'm at a loss for words.... just so unbelievably GOOD. Best meal I've had in ages. Highly highly recommended!

ud9m0jwPv2lfe_aipTeZWw.text: There are three of these places within 1000m along Upper Street, all with similar names and very similar menus. They're clearly doing something right.While the impossibly cramped restaurant offers little in the way of either privacy or space (though it does have truly bizarre decor), the food makes your visit (which will likely be brief) very worthwhile. The starters excel despite my inability to spell any of them, from the creamy yogurt cacik to delightfully smoky baba ganoush. The mains are large and generally quite good. Extra points for the cojones to simply write "special sauce" on the menu.A solid local Turkish semi-chain.

cyQkOKDmU6BAGMApNFf3FQ.text: Gallipoli is fantastic restaurant - delicious food, great selection of vegetarian options, really affordable and the atmosphere is always vibrant and lively. You can even smoke a sisha pipe after dinner... my favourite is apple flavour!The decor is awsome, morccan lamps, candles and dark rich colours on the walls! the staff are very efficient and friendly also! My favourite restaurnt in Upper Street without a doubt!

CNC-J5MP2rLI0hkUnXdjOQ.text: There are three Gallipoli's, nestled close to each other along the central stretch of Upper Street, between the twin hells of Highbury and Islington and the Angel. There is not much to pick between the three restaurants, they are all pretty much as good as each other, which is lucky as if one is full - and they get very busy - you can always try one of the others. The Turkish food is excellent value, large portions (you can bring boys here and they'll be happy) and the vibe is really lively and fun. Lots of people come for birthdays and other big celebrations so it's probably not the place to come for an intimate tete-a-tete. The tables are fairly closely packed so you can find yourself being slightly drawn into other people's revelry but not in a hellish TFI Friday sort of way.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom

cIggocSmTCHfCe9qodXeQg.text: Went to this restaurant last week with friends and although I was quite drunk at the time, I can very clearly say that this place offers a great meal for a great price.  I got a very simple meal of chicken kebabs with several glasses of wine-I would be back for it again!  The waiter was friendly and helpful and the restaurant was very accommodating for our large group of 12 people.

sqzXGctCXNHfj2wGtLk4cA.text: The ambiance here is great and the crowd is always lively.  This is by far my favourite Turkish restaurant in the city.  Their food is consistently superb and I always go with the set meals because you get a taste of everything.  Not to mention, the prices are hard to beat (set meals range from £15-18 pp).

6-Se6oYeZKM0M0uJyi2CJQ.text: The Gallipoli restaurants on Upper Street have great atmosphere, whether night or day. The soft lighting from the colorful lamps and ornate hookahs give a wonderful setting for a relaxed turkish coffee or mint tea. The food is amazing, and really large portions too. I love the lively atmosphere, its very popular even on the weekdays. On the summer evenings, you can sit outside and smoke a hookah on the pavement, which looks like so much fun. Its one of the things to do in the late spring evenings too.

cYhgj07cy8K0eN18K3MhRg.text: Fine lunch. Artichoke hearts go well in a crisp red cabbage and salad with dill dressing. Char-grilled chicken breast on bed of wheat rice, sultanas, garlic, pine nuts and cream! Wow! £7.95 , I think i'll be back. Great service from waiter who was proud of the food

SFvXUsZx8B77BqymY4zjNQ.text: Charming Turkish restaurant in Islington.  Went in one afternoon for a light snack, and was delighted by the delicious portions served.  My girlfriend had ordered the mezze for only a few pounds, expecting just a couple dips and snacks.  It came on a huge platter, a big meal onto itself, had several dips like yogurt, hummus, and pieces of falafel.  I ordered the kofte kebab sandwich, which is minced lamb in a pita bread.  Again, was just looking for a light snack and expecting a few small pieces of meat in my pita bread.  The portion of kofte was very generous for only like £5.  The staff's very friendly there, and the decor is fun with all the lamps hanging on the ceiling.  We both walked out with stuffed bellies.

a6a7pOVcivRyAPTspP0OKw.text: I try and eat out as much as I can afford (so not very often!), and despite wanting to go to try different places, frequently find myself back here! I'm a massive fan of Turkish food, so anywhere that does it well will quickly become a favourite. Although it can get extremely busy, the service is always good and the food always of a great standard. The Meze plate is more often than not my starter (really varied selection, always freshly prepared - or at least it seems like it!), and I usually have a lamb steak or kebab as the main. The meat is always tender and the flavours subtle but tasty. I'm not a fan of tagines and the like, so tend to stay away from that side of the menu, but I've been here with both friends and family - and have never heard a bad word, not least a complaint.

AOQvaMOw8V8mMDpSWr66qg.text: This intimate, lively and nicely affordable restaurant is a great choice for something a little different in the Angel Islington area. The staff are very friendly and the delicious Turkish food is very tasty, while portions are refreshingly generous . On a hot summer's day (!) you can sit outside as well and watch the world go by on Upper Street.My only criticism is that on a birthday the raucousness can grate a little. Unless it is your birthday though, and you will find yourself drinking a shot and climbing onto the table in no time! Definitely worth a visit.

kwsOQDBqKfaUlTOhEwTNow.text: Enticed by the gorgeous display of desserts at the window, I dropped in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. The Mediterranean décor inside really created a cozy and authentic ambiance, perfect atmosphere for a good catch up with friends.I ordered a cappuccino and a turkey, ham, cheese panini. The coffee tasted very diluted and on the burnt side, and the panini was quite standard though I have to say it leant towards being greasy. Thankfully this was partially saved by a bit of salad on the side with a vinaigrette! For just under £7, I have to say it's not bad. I think I would probably have had better luck ordering their specialities though.The staff were great and did not hurry to rush us out despite the café being quite busy. So despite the food not being quite so tantalising for my taste buds, the café is a great joint to just have a long conversation. Since I was quite full by the end of it, I didn't quite make it to the sweet things that caught my eye, perhaps next time I will skip the lunch and go straight to the cakes!

r6BI6cMYslEHHIX1JUMJsA.text: Went here for my stag evening many moons ago. The portions were massive and the staff incredibly friendly. In hindsight, I couldn't think of a better place to start the evening off!

JKVFaQWWvfqcR9UmRKBmnQ.text: My favourite Turkish restaurant in London. Great food quality and service. Give it a go. Everyone i know who has been there raves about it too.

3YlM7lTbEE9yYJwzKvkFTQ.text: The lunch special was a good deal - 7.95 for 2 courses - so we both chose the red lentil soup and the seafood paella. The lentil soup was really nice - a little lemony and perfect for an autumn day. It was served with a generous basket of Turkish bread. Then the seafood paella came out and it was huge! I counted at least three big prawns, four mussels, and about four substantial chunks of various kinds of fish (I spotted tuna, salmon and swordfish). Lots of nice bits of vegetables in there as well, and the rice was deliciously flavored. There was also a side salad of rocket and cucumber that went really well with the savory paella. Service was friendly and there was a nice atmosphere inside - not too lively but not too quiet either.

n7f-XeWPWBtiS-cYRu-SnQ.text: The trio of Gallipoli restaurants on Upper Street are cheap, cheerful and so are always packed to the rafters with hungry diners.  I've often walked past on weekends looking in at what promises to be a quality dining experience, only to have to continue on to somewhere less busy.   Inside is very atmospheric, ornate lamps, flickering candles, and dark painted walls add to the ambiance of the place. Share a bottle of wine or treat yourself to a Turkish beer, and dig in to the fairly substantial portion of food.   Enough to keep the hungriest satisfied, no wonder Gallipoli is always so busy.

I1q9Fj-vPxjlQ-26aqdkhg.text: This was one of our favorite dining experiences while in London most recently. 4.5 stars, maybe even 5 stars but I guess I reserve 5 stars for life-changing dining experiences.  We found Gallipoli based on Yelp reviews (our dining in London was largely driven by Yelp -- so cool and efficient and all great experiences!)  We dined with our two vegetarian friends and every single thing we ate was DELICIOUS.  I don't say that lightly, I loved everything we ordered, and we over-ordered a bit just to sample. We over-ate, in fact! The meat dishes (lamb and beef) were great, but the veggie dishes were the stars.  We got there late, waited about 10 minutes for a 4-top, and drank two bottles while consuming way too many small plates. I'd definitely return and recommend it for anyone who would appreciate a wonderful smallish, charming spot with tons of character AND very delicious food. Oh, and the service was perfect:  friendly, engaged, and just attentive enough without being intrusive.

MOf3prV57Qb53vYJ_xw15w.text: Confusingly, there are three Cafe Gallipoli's along this street so make sure you know which you're going to if you've made a reservation. The food is delicious, the portions are huge and the set menu is a bargin. The atmosphere is very lively, and you get to watch people make fools of themselves dancing on tables.

CGooTAC12a0KRo3G1bxLyA.text: Excellent service and value for money. We went last night, the restaurant was packed, yet our waiter was efficient, friendly and good for a laugh! The food was more than enough, and enjoyed by everyone at our table. The vegetarian with us noted that she had a good selection of dishes to choose, which is not usually the case. The lamb knuckle absolutely delicious!

Z7sRbmRzgeLy7Q4M0swu1A.text: I went a short time ago for my unique birthday the afternoon meal and will only state that this place is extraordinary, Divine, delightful, enchanting. There likely aren't enough adjectives to explain this places grace.we had starters, mains and desserts and many types of four individuals had nothing at all to complain about, for my loved ones, that claims a lot and we were still talking regarding how good it was today. Our waitress was talkative and revealed his appreciation on the menu that is something I a great deal appreciate and the chef turned out to communicate to us that is something I wish more places would do given it shows an interest and appreciation of your customers.Service was friendly and knowledgeable too. A wine was recommended to suit the dishes we had chosen and bread, butter and water was proferred rapidly.Mains included several different dishes, I don't recall what everyone had as most people started sharing food that has a delighted promiscuity.To get flawlessly sincere, I suppose this is my new favourite restaurant.

_G7Byjuzo6Qx098A4z8FSA.text: Passed this place a few times along Upper Street and had always thought it looked nice but passed it off as probably being a bit pricey and not that great.Decided to take a chance on it the other night and was not disappointed. The atmosphere was bustling and I get the impression that its no tthe place to linger over wine and conversation but was an ideal pre-movie meal. We tried the vine leaves which were a little small for our liking but the flavour was fine, better was the babaganoush. We've been searching for a decent version of this lovely aubergine dip in London and have finally found itdelicious. My wife and I both had lamb kebabs which were grilled to perfection and no shortage of smokey bbq goodness.All in all a solid place to go if you fancy a quick, tasty meal, with good atmosphere. We'll definitely be back.

cHy9MlGOOrL7_NjuidxlYg.text: I didn't think so much of this place the first time I went.  I mean, it's pretty good, but Turkish food is very much meat, rice, and vegetables in varying combinations.However, on my last trip I realized that I have ended up going here every couple of weeks for the last year.  The reasons?1.) Turkish food is very much meat, rice, and vegetables.  It's tasty, it's simple, it's relatively healthy.  Gallipoli does a great job.2.) The restaurant is conveniently designed to remind tall people how drunk they are due to the bells and various other accoutrement hanging at head height throughout the venue.3.) The restaurant is conveniently designed to encourage drinking due to awesome cozy atmosphere and friendly waiters.4.) The restaurant is conveniently designed to maintain drunkenness due to free shots handed out by dancing waiters after 11 PM on Saturday nights.5.) The restaurant is conveniently designed to confuse drunken Australians due to the fact that there are three Gallipoli restaurants on Upper St.6.) The restaurant is conveniently designed to embarrass drunken Australians by providing Turkish apparel and a chair upon which to dance.7.) The restaurant is conveniently named so as to allow drunken Australians to expostulate on Australia's worst military campaign in history.Hurrah for convenience!

MsUJwRSG3zk1a53Vz5jTLQ.text: Thank goodness for Laura's picture that identified this one as the one next to Odd Bins because I wasn't sure which of the trifecta I went to!  I am assuming the food is the same at all three (some shared ktichen somewhere in a back alley along Upper Street), but have no confirmation of this since their website is down.  Solid food--a bit of an overwhelming menu--how many ways can you do grilled meat?  Well obviously at least 20 different ways--maybe with a side of rice, or maybe on a bed of yogurt, or maybe it is chicken and beef instead of chicken and lamb.  But it all tastes delicious.  Love the mezze spread, because what's not to love about hummous and fallafel and other Middle Eastern inspired deliciousness in seven little plates in front of you with a big basket of bread!  The food is a solid performance.The space is a bit cramped--a woman knocked over the water glass at our table with her handbag as she was walking out and there may have been some other elbows that my dinner guests occurred.  Decor is a bit dizzying--lots of lamps and pictures on the wall, and the service is just okay, but I'd get my hummous, lamb and aubergine cravings satisfied here any day or night.

kytiHdG4lGdHOleKYpJfrQ.text: This is a cute small Turkish restaurant. The interior is warm and creates an Eastern atmosphere with many lamps hanging from the ceiling and many frames with old photos on the walls. The service is good as well.But I'm afraid the good things end there.The appetisers were not tasting great, not to mention that they were not very authentic either. The main dishes that we had were simple and well-cooked, but frankly, you can get the same kebab in basically every corner in London. The dessert list is a joke...The only Turkish item is a (horrible) baklava and there is a choice of "European" items like Profiteroles(wtf?). These guys could just send someone with a bus to nearby Green Lanes and get some baklava for their store. But I guess, why bother? In addition to that, they do not offer Turkish tea (due to lack of space, according to one of the waiters). That is a big success, since this is the first (out of many around the world) Turkish restaurants that does not offer the traditional tea. Even my Turkish barbers in London serve such tea!

xRuTr4UcyBuMulHgJ73sYg.text: Gallipoli is fantastic restaurant - delicious food, great selection of vegetarian options, really affordable and the atmosphere is always vibrant and lively. You can even smoke a sisha pipe after dinner... my favourite is apple flavour!The decor is awsome, morccan lamps, candles and dark rich colours on the walls! the staff are very efficient and friendly also! My favourite restaurnt in Upper Street without a doubt!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom

BkrCZE37c4UFuHpbvfhuLg.text: This place is the total package!1. Stellar food: the meats are tender, the veggies are crisp and fresh, the wine is perfect and the portions were huge (and by huge, I mean American-sized huge!) The desserts are great too!2. Location and Decor: they have three great locations right by each other and so close to my flat all with Moroccan lamps hanging from the ceiling, cool photos, candles give it a great cozy, romantic vibe3. Service: Very attentive and funny

xueAzRcGNBw8b_TaCkiGJg.text: This place is amazing. So much meze. It was mezetronic. A mezeopolis. More meze then you could fit in your fez...e. OK, that last one was bad, but I feel this video accurately sums up what my delightful experience at Gallipoli was like: youtube.com/watch?v=v-YD…A group of us (I'm making friends just fine Mom!) decided on the fixed menu #2 which led to meze AND full dinners AND deserts AND gross, but oddly tasty shots our waiter bought us. Apparently "Gallipoli" is Turkish for gluttony and that's alllllllright by me. All around good times.

ou95DF0H1g25yZABns616w.text: We ate here two weekends in a row. Mr Q loved it! We both got the sucuk with yogurt sauce. Wish we could have tried some other dishes but the sucuk was so good we ordered it again the 2nd time around. Both times we didn't book ahead and when we got there it wasn't too crowded but by the time we were leaving it was getting pretty busy, so you may want to make a reservation just in case.

lQZCSd5fjLAYm-4AgoiVzw.text: Great Turkish food. Mouthwatering aromas. It offers best deal in price and quality.

hyY57N0VsdBYBAtxsBKPag.text: Stunning place with stunning food. recommend it to anyone to go.

0BzkBdOHA1yt0pharsPf-Q.text: My sister and I stopped here for lunch at the weekend and I chose it simply because it had a spare table outside. I'm so glad we did choose it because the food was delicious. So full of flavour. The 2 course lunch menu is worth every penny. My sister had a spicy kofte filled with cheese and I had the chicken with pitta and salad. To start we shared the most amazing dip with chunks of bread. The staff are friendly and it's got a good vibe about it. I think being seated indoors might be a bit cramped though... all part of the bijoux charm I suppose.

qh0E2-OFpLQPA5-Ulla24g.text: Great place. Our friends in London took us here our first night in town. We had a wonderful time, and I don't think that's just the jetlag-induced delirium talking. Weeks later, I'm still thinking about the plate after plate of delicious meze. As other reviewers have mentioned, this seems to be a popular spot for birthdays and other celebrations. Two such groups were there when we were, and the waitstaff encouraged them to celebrate by dancing on their chairs. In short order, everyone in the restaurant had followed suit, transforming the restaurant into one of the more bizarre dance parties I've ever seen. Fun times.

tGV0GRQWB-tgShIPgXlUVQ.text: Almost my favourite restaurant - either here or Gallipoli Again which serves the same menu. It's always good, there's always loads of food, and the bill is always cheaper than I think it's going to be, considering I feel I can only roll out of the door. Perfect for a group dinner, just order all the meze you fancy, add a couple extra dishes for luck, and you're away. I've never had anything bad. The main courses are great too, if you can fit them in. The decor is cool as well, though you might not think so if you like 'minimalist chic'!Beware, if you have your birthday here they do actually make you stand on a chair and dance awkwardly while they sing..... I have photographic evidence and it's not pretty!

CD4r74n7Opb9Ctg__8L4dg.text: I though the food was okay but we were jammed in an awkward table in the corner which really killed the experience (made it feel a little dingy).  Mediterranean food isn't very complicated and I expected more out of our dishes.  Service was also a little slow

uWobznDqFy_SgAvO-GyD_w.text: Overrated! For someone that adores Turkish food and will salivate over tarmasalata, this was a major disappointment. People had been raving to me about the food here and it was a big wah wah! We ordered the vegetarian meze plate to share and a bunch of other dishes. The meze was not great, a mess of similar-type cold dishes - it just seemed unfriendly. Can you describe food as unfriendly? Well I'm going to! I was looking forward to our prawn dish, but that never arrived, it was put on the bill though. Thanks. The waiters do that creepy standing around your table thing that you get in a lot of small restaurants and all the lamps and decor on the walls and ceilings must be hellish for a claustrophia sufferer. Soz Gallipolli, I will not be back.

gypK6rO4qb6PWJlHZth3HQ.text: The meze collection for two or more people is excellent value for money for less than £9 per person. You are served over ten dishes including items such as hummus, falafel, vine leaves, stewed lamb, chicken and various bean salads. Round it all off with one of their superb desserts which adorn the glass window by the entrance of the restaurant. The combination fresh mint teas are wonderful (try the mint tea with rosewater v. nice). The Turkish apple tea is also quite pleasant but pretty sweet. Vegetarians are catered for well here too.

Z0qs7b9c24NFoD2qoV-vog.text: A small place and they pack you in tight but the atmosphere is great. We had dancing in the chairs and belly dancing! Food was ok, we had meze for 3 which was fairly standard (falafel, kofte, houmous, haloumi etc) but was nice. Would go again for the atmosphere and was good value.

QkH4SDJ2d5cRdjIpKt_v3g.text: The Full Mezze and Iskandar are the best. Try Galipolli Again for bigger parties and Galipolli cafe for a more lively atmosphere

egTLPZ4B4FXzk85g2EnRJw.text: Ate at a table outside here at the weekend - the atmosphere was lovely but it was a bit noisy inside! The food was great; I had a chicken kebab which was a very generous portion, but was perhaps a touch on the dry side (and I got a very strange look when I asked for some minty yoghurty). Overall, very good value and very friendly!

LxVYu8y-lsHm7itm8AuU6g.text: Fabulous food, have eaten here on numerous occasions and has always been of good quality, the meze is really nice as is the 102  special. VERY VERY NICE, the atmosphere is nice old ottoman style decor. Highly Recommended.

_-EUsl-sLCL64HEgAdraTg.text: One lazy Sunday afternoon I wanted to have a glass champagne and celebrate...well nothing  really! So I chose Gallipoli on my stroll around Upper Street before I meet my friend for movies.I ordered four starters and I had nothing to complain about: good portion size, tasty and fresh. I had calamari, prawns, borek and some salad. All were perfectly cooked - though I do realise it is not much for mediterranean!I would come back for another lazy weekend meal - for sure! I just love the decor inside - do try to get a table by the window - to do some people watching!

kFIZT_dg_ZFR_v3LLy1JCg.text: Came here on Friday with 7 friends. It was Valentine day, so the place had a bit of "romantic" twist with rose petals and a pre sent menu at £25 for 3 courses. Overall the atmosphere is nice, as a mediterranean bistrot.The starters were mezze to share (hummus, tzaziki etc), then we had one main each. i had the Shish Tauk (I think it is written in this way, the chicken marinated cubes with rice). it was very good and abundant.My friends had wonderful desserts (brownies with ice creams among others), I had a shot of amaretto instead. I will come back on a normal night to check out the a la carte menu.

Vfsg8a0qJFaZV_-cATbRaA.text: Been here couple of times and have always loved it. The food, the ambience, the staff everything is great. There are three of Gallipoli's - two serve Turkish while the remaining one serves Turkish and Lebanese. Not sure if they serve Shisha but they had the setup though.In terms if food, try anything with Moussaka (mezze or mains) its great, the meat dishes especially large mix meat is perfect of you wish to try different types lamb and chicken they offer, felafel is decent but the dips are fantastic. Pamukkale white and Cankaye wines for vegetarian dishes (or if drinking only) is great. Pamukkale red and Yakut greatly compliments the meat dishes.If you dont fancy drinking alcohol, quench your thirst try with Ayran (very similar to buttermilk). It's generally a summer drink and helps hydrate and cool the body (okay, too technical, drink what you like).Havnt tried the sweets yet (I know, such a shame but get stuffed with starters and mains every single time). Give yourself a couple of hours as this place with its the delicious food, great decor (all three have a different element to them) and friends make a wonderful memory.P.S. - One of the good places to impress your date if she is big on food and eastern ambience.

E4gQKxLzllIhXMQ5PkkmwQ.text: First time here and very impressed. The food is simple yet tasty. The service is brisk but attentive and the price was reasonable for a popular part of town. Would definitely return.

pNFzU3kmFDGiLtYXVpjnXQ.text: Outstanding. My girlfriend and I are visiting from Canada and came here for her birthday.  So impressed with the food, ambience and service. Try the baba ghannuge, sucuk izgara (spicy Turkish garlic sausage) or chicken wings!

PEJzOkNPoi-BjaFz5WcxxQ.text: Walked in for the first time and I was surprised by the interior. The ceiling was covered with different lanterns and the walls had different kinds of art-- it was small but it felt cozy. I ordered the Gallipoli special and when my hot plate arrived I was amazed by both the aroma and portion. The previous restaurants I've been to weren't as generous. The lamb was flavorful, koete was a little spicy (a nice change with all the Chinese food I've had) and matched with the pita bread it was fantastic. The rice with what I think is lentils had an interesting texture and the salad had a vinagette that tastes home made. My sis had some samosa looking thing that came with humus, and 2 other dippings and those were great as well.The staff is very friendly and welcoming. Had I stayed longer I would have come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Gallipoli special
Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom

fWzSP7NGnhRtcYVkIeNCUg.text: Great all round.Excellent, friendly and efficient service right from entry to departure.Great menu selection and very good food. Generous portions, well crafted and excellent  value.Bustling atmosphere with interior decor to match. A great fun place to eat on Upper St.

BNAC09jpnBr20mNJ86vmbg.text: Been here many times... and will return when in Islington.  Bookmarked it on Yelp so that I can share it with friends.  Great place(s).

oCGnCIXWw14WQpU-fbEVWw.text: This is one of those amazing gems, scattered around London. The food is Turkish and the tradition is something being held quite high in their priority list. The decorations are amazing and being able to transfer you to the country itself. Food is not expensive and even cheap-ish, I might say. There's also a huge difference in the amount of food you get and the money you pay for it. Order the meze special and you won't regret it and might even return for more, as in my case.

6hu_GUceUhlbPLZLHRVaxQ.text: Really good restaurant, location, and value for money.The mezze platters are amazingly tasty, and you won't need any other main course nor dessert after that :)The greek salad is not that good though (fake feta...), and the noise level downstairs was comparable to that of a club at 1 PM : too loud for a dinner !!!!Will go again and again !

0r88G_BQDdGJE-2yAVEg3A.text: having spent 3 weeks in the middle east you would have thought that this cuisine had bored me-but i was craving hummus and the aroma of lamb and beef drew me in to this busy restaurant. I took the window seat and ordered the hummus and a side order marinated lambs liver to start. I also ordered plain carrot juice without orange-what arrived was carrot juice with orange-never a good combination. the hummus was ok but the bread was a pitifully small portion and was clearly not produced on the premises-flat and cold. The lamb and chicken shish was average and came with rice (which I didn't request) would have preferred more salad. That said i can imagine this place is buzzing in the evenings and a preferred option to the horsemeat served in the local kebab takeaways!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom

7q14w6hn1jYwf1LvmIa7gA.text: Nom nom nom... I am a huge fan of the Trifecta of Gallipoli's Upper Street manifestation, and having to choose one over the other normally involves finding the location with the shortest wait. (Seriously, if I would have known Lebanese and Turkish food was this good, I would NOT have waited 27 years to indulge in the deliciousness.) But this Gallipoli holds a special place in my heart for their outdoor sheesha patio. Sitting on upper street, sipping up strawberry, orange, rose and mint hubbly-bubbly, and watching the world go by is a pretty fantastic way to spend a lazy evening. The Cheshire Cat and I give 5-stars way up.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Google Streetview

fedT4sv7LYK0tLb-ILv9wg.text: Visited this establishment on Friday night (and have occasionally frequented for lunch) - it was absolutely rammed so would certainly recommend booking. Had a couple of cocktails to whet the appetite. Shared a Gallipoli meze and some halloumi cheese, which was nice although perhaps might have been better to have the meze items in separate dishes as the couple next to us did as it got messy on one plate. Had the 102 Upper Street special as a main dish, which consisted of lamb kofte, chicken pieces and lamb pieces with rice and salad. Kofte was a bit too charred for my liking, though. Rocking atmosphere with a few large parties - bartender stood on the bar and did the Gangnam style! Would recommend but avoid prime time (Fri, Sat evening) if you want a quieter dinning experience. Just over £50 (inc. 10% service) for two including a couple of cocktails was possibly a bit pricy for what it was considering we were heading to the local cinema afterwards. Wasn't blown away by the food, but an enjoyable meal nonetheless.

R64mDZVpqIf6NBmlvba2rg.text: Ok, let me get the one bad thing out of the way: the service was a bit slow at first. We didn't book, we just turned up and they said to come back an hour later if we wanted to stay for longer than an hour - of course we did. Turkish food? I'm gonna savour it! We came back at the time they suggested, at the same time as two 10+ sized parties, but luckily we were two. After about 15 minutes waiting by the door we were seated, but we were alright with it because we weren't in a rush.It was made up for anyway. We sat down and they immediately took a great interest in our comfort and leisure, served us quickly and were very friendly and chatty. The waiter even made a couple of jokes about people on dates like any nice waiter would to break the ice a little bit.Later, when he apologised for the wait I asked if he could throw in a bit of free flatbread to make up for it. He happily agreed to and it was delicious with some fantastic hommous.The Chicken & Potato dish was fantastic, as was the Lamb Variant, and the Dolmades worked very nicely as a starter, even to my date, a Turkish food newbie.The fact that they were so good to customers as soon as they were actually customers meant more than just trying to woo new customers into coming in, I think, and the food more than made up for it anyway. Good job, Gallipoli!

AHEr6ZKfAsDBR3yGnNC01w.text: Amazing food and ultra-pleasant service. Be prepared to feast like a king while paying prole prices.Really, all you need to know is to order the Set Meal 1. It comes in two waves - one of cold mezzes, then one of hot mezzes. At least two people in your party must order it at ~£11 each, but it's more than satisfying.Winners of the set had to be the juicy mitite kofte (which went exceptionally well with the yogurty manca) and the simple, but satisfying humus. Sometimes the standards are just what you need. Also, if a server asks you if you want the chili sauce, say "Yes, please!" early and often. I kind of wanted to buy a tub of it to take home!Though we were in a rush to leave to scoot on to our next destination, we were each graciously offered a sample of baklava as we piled out the door. Not only did they fill us up, but they sent us packing with one for the road. How can you -not- love a place like that?NB: Be sure to arrive early. It turns out that all of the Gallipolis are quite popular with the weekend dinner crowd.

mCKZxGRa4S6xh9sSssz4Qw.text: I Love this place! One of the best, if not the best, restaurant I have eaten at in London.The restaurant is very small, but very good (which is why there is three of them I guess). The restaurant has an authentic flair with all its decorations and the staff is Mediterranean, so that I though I was on vacation (one can dream right?). I am a pescetarian, so I greatly appreciated their great veggie options, but first the hummus was delicious!! In fact everything was delicious and I was there with a group of 10 or so. We all had different things and not one person had less to say than 'amazing'! The prices are also very reasonable (main dishes are less than £10) especially since it is located on Upper Street in Angel.I would definitely recommend this place for people well everyone, unless you don't like Mediterranean food, but if you're going with more than 3/4 people I would make a reservation beforehand, cuz the place is pretty small!I'll be back soon and dragging everyone of my visitors there!!

b4bMgMqzTFsqqW5QiPXlLQ.text: A Turkish Valentine's Delight.After months & months of walking by, peering in, continued walking, and regret for not stopping - we finally went to Gallipoli for a Valentine's dinner and whoa what a dinner it turned out to be.1st thing that jumps out at you in Gallipoli is the decor. Turkish/Moroccan lamps hanging from the ceiling (I'm tall & hit my head) and old pictures & artifacts from past empires.I couldn't tell if I was in Bzyantium, Constantinople, or Istanbul - - but I knew it was somewhere in the eastern portion of present-day Turkey, which coincidentially enough is called Gallipoli.Our first decision was the wine - which we immediately chose this Turkish white that turned out to be substantially better than I was expecting from a country not known for the vineyards.Then the 2 course set-menus. Cold Mezze platter & Jumbo Grilled Prawns. Success. Lamb & Chicken grilled skeweres and a Meat Mousakka (spicy Turkish lasagna) Success. Food was off the hook and came in a portion the size of a 3 month old child. Success.Service was lightning quick. The staff provided me with ample assistance while catering to my novice knowledge of the Turkish language when inquiring about specific dishes on the menu.Food down. Turkish coffee brought to the table. Another success.When we paid the bill and were sitting letting the massive amount of Turkish delight fester within our abdomens - our server brought us over two complimentary glasses of god knows what in a fancy glass. Following a swift snap of my neck - the lightning water was quickly down the hatch and I was out the door leaving nothing but a phenominal experience behind me.Thank you Gallipoli.

SO-Pg2z18awU6wgzgtqdhw.text: Gallipoli is a great local place to go grab a cheap bite to eat.  The food is always tasty and between the string of Gallipoli family cafes along Upper Street, you never have to wait long for food.In the summertime when they open the windows there's no better place to sit and people watch while munching on mezze.It's always lively and the staff are friendly and attentive.  I've come by with just 2 people or up to 8 and always had a great time.

cTt1rZwXmmvh8yM9uH5hDQ.text: Nice casual Turkish restaurant in the heart if Islington. Can't go wrong with the mezze platter!There are 3 locations all on Upper Street. Go to the 1st coming from Angel.

7_3W3H80NEEGRgP6Jhl0gA.text: The Hummus with Lamb is delicious.  Actually, everything I've ever had here is terrific.  Staff is helpful, but they pack a LOT of people in this joint.  Very crowded during peak times.  Very noisy during peak times.  Delicious ALL the time.  During peak time, this place gets 4 stars.. I can't even hear my self think.  During off peak, 5 stars.

eFn3wdg17eRf4Y_W6PFzQw.text: I give it 5 stars for quality, ambiance, friendliness of the staff and value in price. Great restaurant. You will not regret it if you try it. We came from the US for 5 days on a business trip and I looked for a Turkish restaurant. This was among many options and it was absolutely the right decision.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom

RqVfBbmF8mYfpUN-_PrRZg.text: Came here with some friends after watching a movie and hadn't realised just how many eateries were in the area! Luckily this one was also open till late as it was 10pm when we got out! We ended up sharing between the 3 of us, one main course, and 5 mezze platters. Luckily that was enough as we weren't too hungry, and although we did think of getting the sharing platters, at around 17 pounds PER PERSON after 5pm was just a bit too much.The mezze platters were decently sized, although you only get 3 falafel balls with a small splat of hummus for the mezze plate. However, the taramasalata was a good portion size and I assume all their mezze dip portions would be a healthy size as well. We didn't get extra pita bread, so I'm not sure if getting more would cost extra! But if you get some meaty mains, you could always just eat it with that....My third friend ordered a chicken main, which was also quite decent for the cost. However I think the amount of meat he got was about the same amount that you get on a mezze plate, just served with a side of rice, pita bread, 2 helpings of yoghurt dip and a kind of eggplant ragu. All in all the food was tasty and the service was good, but I think you're probably better off ordering several mezze platters and sharing that with at least one other person, if you're not eating on your own! But I guess if you're hungrier than that you could also add in a main course. It's always better to share anyway!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Portion size of mezze plates! Lamb on the left and falafel on the right.

OGE3eERyjT_DvLp9IX9Kcw.text: Recommended to me by a chic friend who lived in Angel. This is a really fun atmosphere with good food to bolster it! It's a bit tight on space, but that's what also gives its charm. You won't be disappointed with the dishes, especially the meat platters were very good. And it won't hurt your pocket book at all. We downed a few beers, chatted it up, and had a good time all around. Will be back.

GpegcD9N5SgZUR5JAEL3Hw.text: Besides the long waiting time for the food to come, many good things to say here!1. Food was good, delicious, the grilled chicken was a little dry compared to the Afghan style which is marinated with yogurt.  The limb was very tender and juicy.  The wrap was good too.2. Service was good, very attentive. Free desserts at the end. Take out box with a bag and a smile. Very friendly staff.3. Price is good too. It is not cheap but it is reasonable with decent portion. Sit inside under the big skylight and the meal will be filled with sunshine!Enjoy!PS: Around the corner, you could get grilled chicken Turkish style from Angel Kebab, cheaper but you get what you pay for!

Xub5brHOSI7MBrZW9awBCg.text: The food is average / sub par. In general it was either it is too salty or too sweet. -dolmas had some type of syrup on it and was nauseatingly sweet.-Hummus was ok. Average-Shish Tavuk - chicken was well cooked and tender-mixed grill - ground lamb kebab was very salty.Nothing special and not that great. Would not go again.

hmsS1L4p3hCjD77PC--Bjg.text: Not to be confused with the Gallipoli restaurant just up the road, this Bistro is owned by the same people. Slightly confusing. The food, though. We had the baba ganoush, fried aubergine and goats cheese mezze as light bites to share. All excellent. Our pal let us try some of his grilled lamb. Gorgeously smoky, utterly tender. Alas, I didn't have a big enough appetite to do justice to the menu, but if I ever get the chance I will return ravenous. The service is efficient and friendly, and you sit under a ceiling of low-hanging Middle-eastern lamps. A real Turkish delight.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Amezzing

IRg9dk-Q86zpW8vFL_8tHw.text: We were looking for a cozy spot for late dinner on Sunday and walked upon Gallipoli while strolling on Upper Street. The ceiling is dotted with warm lighting and the tables with candlelight. We were very pleased that they were open to 11 pm. My husband and I shared a beautiful bottle of Syrah and went with the mezze  since we couldn't decide. So excellent, the right amount for two people. We particularly enjoyed the lima bean salad and the velvety hummos. The lamb was particularly tender. We would have ordered dessert but it was late and we were too full. Service was just the right amount of attentive. Highly recommend for a late dinner spot if you are looking for something warm and cozy.

GGJQpcvjVPLw7jc8ZfKZ-g.text: Turkish breakfast was delicious and service was great! Lots of little Turkish inspired memorabilia and decor, if that's your thing.

JPA99bLIBK-yLoRbacQ6DQ.text: We had a great meze .... a table laden with tasty dishes, too many to recount!  A few of the most memorable ... hummus, koftes, borek, dolmades, chickpea and mint salad, broad beans....all lovely and all tasting fresh and different, washed down with an efes or two.We left happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Let there be lights!
Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Meze for two

6bWgx9FTNtuv20neqG08xg.text: Very nice Turkish on upper st. Visited too many time to remember and have always come away happy. A Meal for two plus wine your looking at around £60 which is ok for Upper st. This place is all about cool location and the lovely venue rather than the food. However if like me you live in North London we are very lucky to be spoilt with a number of excellent Turkish restaurants. If it's all about the food,portion size and cost then I suggest you head to Green Lanes where you can find a dozen places with portions double in size for half the price. Check out my review on Gokyazu which is a 10 minute walk from Manor House station. This place is great if on a night out in Islington or if you fancy heading to a lively buzzy restaurant in a cool part of London.

JeVF410KT7Z7tCTvmiEGAQ.text: This was a regular haunt of mine in the 90's back when Islington was the home of New Labour. I moved to the other side of the world but found myself back in London and decided to try Gallipoli again after almost 20 years. I'm happy to report that it is as good as I remember. We shared a plate of tavuk shish. The chicken was perfectly cooked and seasoned, super moist with a perfect char. We also got a plate is Iskender. Absolutely delicious sauce. Get the bread to mop it up. We also had the amazing broad beans in Turkish yoghurt which was incredible. We tried the Turkish wine and weren't fans. That's the only negative we had.

xYNpaPtJI4yCcbRI7DrC6w.text: Echoing everyone else here on Yelp, get the full meze! Surprised that this place wasn't more packed a so went on a Thursday evening and it was really easy to get a table.Really attentive staff, fast service and we even got a free shot of Bailey's each!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Wheelbarrow next to our table!
Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Ceiling

X2Z-gfxjQQ9e1qBKMA7ROw.text: In London there's always new places to go so I try to never go to the same place twice, but I've been to Gallipoli 3 times so it only means that I absolutely love this place. We always get the set dinner which serves a bit of everything on their menu, which I personally like because I love to try/sample everything. For so much to eat, it's a great price that can't compare to other Turkish restaurants. Not only is the food great, but the atmosphere is amazing. The plethora of hanging lamps gives out an ethnic, homey aura and even though it's constantly busy, you can sit in there for ages and enjoy the setting. I also like the outdoor seating, where you can see bustling Angel.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom

4avxoR2T7SX1Vbz3sGdFuA.text: Perfect low key place on upper street to spend the afternoon. I was looking for a place to have a light meal and juice whilst catching up with a friend. We ordered some sharing mezza and a couple of juices all for under 20 quid. The tables are sharing tables across the center so it doesn't feel extremely private if that is the vibe you're going for. But the staff was friendly and left us on our own to catch up.

Z3X7uEW4mpZRPTujtZm6gQ.text: - visit on a Saturday night for dinner: reservation recommended- small restaurant/bistro, very noisy, crowded, closely spaced: BUT that`s Turkish!! It is very authentic- very friendly staff- first thing we ordered: Turkish Raki (to prepare the stomach for lots of food :-))- nice dishes (very authentic): sucuk izgara (Turkish sausages) 4.50 GBP; Iskender 11.75 GBP; Kofte 9.95 GBP; all big portions and very tasty! I loved it!- for desert we had Turkish tea 1.50 GBP, Turkish coffee 2.35 GBP and Baklava 4.25 GBP (Turkish delight was offered for free): also very authentic and yummy- price absolutely appropriate for the qualityConclusion: It is a 4.5! I really enjoyed it a lot! Very authentic atmosphere and food!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom

Ik76gEiVhgw8i1-d1xhixg.text: This place holds a special place for me, it was the first place my now wife took me for dinner... The venue is suitably decorated with a Turkish theme, lights and pictures cover the walls, the tables are simple heavy wood with matching chairs. There are plenty of seats... Probably a few too many as you have to brush up against other diners to get to your seat.The staff are attentive but they have a job to do and aren't going to spend too much time chit chatting.The food.... It's good, the choice is really good and there are lots of traditional favourites. The meze starter we went for was tasty and had a good variety of choice. If I'm honest I wasn't blown away by anything we had but I would happily return (as I have done).Ok, so I've given it an average review but four stars??!... Well here's the best bit!!! If you check in on Yelp, you get 20% off!!!!!! There were no pre-conditions (we rocked up on a Saturday evening), just show them your screen and boom!!.. 20% off.

v4Z-Htw2bLhk_737kDJg0Q.text: One of my favorite places in London and I came here relatively often. The food, Turkish, was very delicious, and the environment is friendly and comfortable. I enjoy all the dangling lamps, but I am also short so I never worried about hitting them. The appetizer I usually get is the hummus. As for entree, I have tried a variety of the dishes and kebabs, and nothing was ever disappointing. My favorite was the lamb kebab. The dessert here is good also.I have also been to Gallipoli Bazaar and Gallipoli Again. I have had great experiences in the other two as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallipoli Bistro & Cafe - London, United Kingdom

Z1NagZxfw3kF6dOMTiuiMA.text: Lovely interior and staff, but food was nothing special. Went there for dinner with friends this weekend, we shared the meze, and I had the baked stuff aubergine as main (one of the few vegetarian entrées).  The meze were nice, but the aubergine was disappointing: the vegetable stuffing contained canned corn, and the tomato sauce was bland and also tasted like it was straight out of a can.   Perhaps I ordered the wrong entrée, but probably won't return anytime soon.

8vwIHYxDwqoGK8890o7WLA.text: Plenty of choice for any meal, almost couldn't choose but they do have a mixed meze to start giving you a bit of everything. Very good quality food. Staff don't overcrowd you and although the place is busy the tables are arranged so that you feel as if you are in your own cosy room. Decor makes you feel as if you are in someone's front room.

SrqflQsOsYbUcw9WG-Ed1A.text: My flatmate and I came here for dinner on a lovely summer evening, where we got to sit outside on the slightly tilted sidewalk, right next to the bustling Upper Street. The interior of the restaurant is decorated with beautiful glass lanterns, but it was just too nice to not be outside. The staff were friendly and very happy to oblige when I brought my mobile phone in and asked them if I could charge it. We ordered a bottle of wine, and they were kind enough to open new bottles for me to try before I selected one (to my defense, they were all offered by the glass, and so I was surprised that they had to open new ones in order for me to try them). Still, that was extremely generous and I was impressed. We went with the house white wine and got a plate of the mixed meze to share as an appetizer. For mains, we both got the iskender, which is described as tender lamb, laid on pita, with creamy yogurt and secret recipe sauce. It was not at all like I imagined, but such a cool dish! The way that I would describe it is as barbecued pieces of lamb, which sits above the Middle Eastern version of a pasta dish. The secret recipe sauce was just like a tomato pasta sauce, and along with the yogurt, was like a tomato-and-cream blend, and the pita was chewy to the point that it no longer resembled pita at all - at first we thought it was gnocchi or pasta! The meal was extremely filling. Overall, I think this is a nice, casual, and inexpensive place to eat and not a bad Upper Street option.
